Package domain

Class Valoration

java.lang.Object
domain.Valoration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Valoration>
public class Valoration extends Object implements Comparable<Valoration>
This class contains the valuation that a specific user has made for a specific item and is identified by the ItemID and the UserID. {idIt,idUS}.
Author:
Daniel Morón Roces

  • Field Details

    • valuation

      private Double valuation
      • A double number that represents the valuation of the Item made by the user.
      • Possible values that can have: 2, 3.5 or 7.
      • Default value: If valuation = null, valuation is not initialized.

    • idIt

      private Integer idIt
      • A non negative integer number that indicates which item has been valued.
      • A pair of examples can be idIt = 100 or idIt = 456 because is valid when: idIt >= 1.
      • Default value: If idIt = -1, idIt is not initialized.

    • idUs

      private Integer idUs
      • A non negative integer number that indicates which user has made the rating.
      • A couple of valid values can be idUs = 35 or IdUs = 60 because is valid when: idUs >= 1.
      • Default value: If idUs = -1, idUs is not initialized.

  • Constructor Details

    • Valoration

      public Valoration()
      Creates an instance of Valoration without parameters. The values of the attributes represent that they are invalid.

    • Valoration

      public Valoration(Double value, Integer idItm, Integer idUsr)
      Creates an instance of Valoration with all the parameters specified.
      Parameters:
      value - represents the user enjoyment with the item itm.
      idItm - represents the object which has been valued.
      idUsr - represents the person who has been valued the item itm.

    • Valoration

      public Valoration(Integer idItm, Integer idUsr)
      Creates an instance of Valoration with the parameters specified that represent the object's identification.
      Parameters:
      idItm - represents the object which has been valued.
      idUsr - represents the person who has been valued the item itm.

    • Valoration

      public Valoration(String val)
      Creates an instance of Valoration based on the string val. The separation between values in the string must be with ¬. After the transformation, we can get a new object of Valoration with the values.
      Parameters:
      data - is a string that represents an instance of valoration. The first is the ID user, the second is the ID item and the last is the value of the Valoration.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This override method transforms an instance of Valoration to a new string.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string that contains the attributes of the valoration, separated by "¬".

    • compareCr

      public boolean compareCr(Valoration v)
      This method checks the comparison criterion between two instances of Valoration
      Parameters:
      v - is a Valoration which will be used to check the criterion to compare two instances of Valoration. First of all, instances are compared with the Item id (increasing), secondly with User id (increasing) and finally with the valuation (decreasing).
      Returns:
      Returns true if the comparison criterion is fulfilled, however returns false.

    • getValuation

      public Double getValuation()
      This method allows to obtain the valuation from a user to an item.
      Returns:
      Returns a double number which is the value of the attribute valuation.

    • getUser

      public Integer getUser()
      This method allows to get the id of User who has rated.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer number which is the id of the User.

    • getItem

      public Integer getItem()
      This method allows to get the id of the Item that has been valued.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer number which is the id of the Item.

    • setValuation

      public void setValuation(Double value)
      This method updates the value of the attribute valuation. The number is checked to ensure that it is a valid value.
      Parameters:
      value - is a double number that represents the valuation that the user has done.

    • setUser

      public void setUser(Integer idu)
      This method updates the id of the User and checks the number to ensure that is a positive integer number.
      Parameters:
      idu - is the id of the user that has valued the valoration.

    • setItem

      public void setItem(Integer idIt)
      This method updates the id of the Item and checks the number to ensure that is a positive integer number.
      Parameters:
      idIt - is the id of the item that has been valued.
